intro: Astartea fascicularis, commonly known as the clustered starwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures and often edible rhizomes. The plant features basal leaves that are palmately lobed, with a hairy surface that gives it a textured appearance. Its small, white flowers are arranged in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens. Astartea fascicularis is typically found in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
